image.altText: A man wearing a cap and suspenders over a t-shirt stands in a field of a farm. He has a dejected expression.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump's tariffs were designed to punish foreign nations who ran trade deficits with the US. Instead, the policy has put the businesses and industries he's seeking to protect in the crosshairs.

title.children: Americans say Trump's tariffs are causing the US to 'collapse from within'

image.altText: Bupa

props.synopsis: One of Australia's largest private health insurers has agreed to pay back tens of millions of dollars to thousands of members who had hospital claims incorrectly rejected.

title.children: 'We're deeply sorry': Bupa apologises for misleading consumers, agrees to repay $35m

image.altText: A dark grey smoke cloud rising above a dark green forest on the backdrop of a blue sky horizon

props.synopsis: At least two firefighters have been killed when crews responding to a blaze in western Idaho started "taking sniper fire" from at least one suspect, a local sheriff says.

title.children: At least two firefighters killed by 'sniper fire' as US crews battle blaze

image.altText: An image of Erin Patterson.

props.synopsis: The Supreme Court's Justice Christopher Beale is scheduled to resume his final instructions to the jury in Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial. Follow live.

title.children: Judge in Erin Patterson case continues jury instructions

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: The judge turns to the question of motive
The judge issues a warning about alleged lies

image.altText: Man with arms crossed and in black jacket looks sternly into the camera

props.synopsis: More than 80 per cent of unpaid superannuation goes unrecovered — and the agency in charge rarely penalises employers who do not pay it.

title.children: Compulsory super rises to 12pc from July 1, but millions are missing out

image.altText: People carrying umbrellas in the rain

props.synopsis: The SES and the Bureau of Meteorology are warning severe weather set to hit the state this week could see huge rainfall all along the NSW coast.

title.children: 'Need you to prepare': Warning ahead of NSW wild weather

image.altText: A composite image of close ups of Danielle Wood and Jim Chalmers.

props.synopsis: The economic reform round table set down for August will talk about tax reform but a strategy for the future of artificial intelligence and robots should be part of the conversation.

title.children: Tax is part of the productivity equation but so is AI

image.altText: Aerial shot of the riverside Queens Wharf development

props.synopsis: Star Entertainment has received notice that the Hong Kong investors poised to purchase its Brisbane casino stake want to terminate the sale. Follow live.

title.children: Star Entertainment's deal to sell Queen's Wharf casino stake on brink

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Optus Sport to shut down as Premier League rights sold to Stan
ASX opens higher, James Hardie jumps on US approval
Star's financial nightmare rolls on. The deal to sell its mega-Brisbane casino Queen's Wharf is off

image.altText: Penny Wong

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong will head to Washington this week for talks with her US counterpart Marco Rubio, as well as other ministers of the Quad. Follow live.

title.children: Penny Wong heads to the US as tariff deadline looms

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Wong heads to the United States to meet Quad counterparts

image.altText: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley National Press Club

props.synopsis: The issue of gender quotas is the one philosophical and cultural mountain that the Liberal Party has never been prepared to climb. Now former PM Malcolm Turnbull and senator Maria Kovacic are the latest Liberal names to weigh in.

title.children: Sussan Ley says quotas may be a way forward for Liberal women. What's the hold-up?

image.altText: Small children in military uniforms are shown rifles by uniformed military officers and a kindergarten teacher.

props.synopsis: China has long been accused of repression in Tibet and a new report based on rare firsthand accounts from people inside the region sheds light on the way authorities are trying to erase local culture and language.

title.children: The boarding schools where China tries to 'erase' young children's culture: report

image.altText: Evin Prison bike

props.synopsis: Accounts from inside Tehran's Evin Prison are as harrowing as they are rare — many of those locked up inside never make it out. Now Iranian officials say 71 people were killed in an Israeli strike there last week.

title.children: Among all Israel's targets in Iran, this one left some 'in disbelief'

image.altText: The Care Squeeze Graphic no text

props.synopsis: Aged care changes due to come in on November 1 will see self-funded retirees and some pensioners expected to pay more, as future residential care and in-home care residents face a new regime.

title.children: Caring costs the 'sandwich generation' $18k a year, report finds

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How do you know you're eligible for aged care assistance?
Fear drives people to leave it too late

image.altText: Woman with long dark hair taking selfie with father who has white beard

props.synopsis: When my mother first showed signs of dementia, I thought I knew what to expect from the aged care system, having finally secured a home care package for my father. But an even steeper learning curve was ahead.

title.children: What I learned from navigating the aged care system for a second time

image.altText: Someone sitting in front of a bank of computer screens, their shirt says "Shuffle" on the back

props.synopsis: Online casino Shuffle's executives are gambling on its own live broadcasts, despite it being banned in Australia.

title.children: A multi-million-dollar online lottery is bending Australia's laws

image.altText: Building with thick white steam coming out

props.synopsis: Australia's only paper mill uses coal-fired boilers, which its new owner wants to convert to electric, but he says he has been told there is not enough local power in the Tasmanian grid to support this.

title.children: Paper mill owner told not enough power for coal to electric conversion

image.altText: A woman looks at the myTax website on a computer screen, resting her head on her hand

props.synopsis: Many of us just want to get the business of doing their tax returns over and done with. Here's what you need to know before you start.

title.children: The new financial year starts tomorrow. Here's what that means for your taxes

image.altText: A woman in black stands in front of a vivid blue painting.

props.synopsis: Wendy Whiteley reflects on the legacy of her late husband, Archibald Prize-winning artist Brett Whiteley, as his works appear at the only Victorian gallery to host his Inside The Studio exhibition.

title.children: Whiteley showcase reveals struggles with addiction and pursuit of beauty

image.altText: A smiling teenage girl with long, dark hair sits on a beach in a bikini top and long pants.

props.synopsis: The 17-year-old's devastated mother says her memories of her time with her daughter help her smile when the world feels "unbearable".

title.children: Pheobe Bishop to be laid to rest more than six weeks after disappearance

image.altText: An aerial shot of trees fringing a cleared area of land.

props.synopsis: A farming body says The Wilderness Society's claims regarding instances of land clearing in Queensland are misleading.

title.children: Drone footage sparks clash over land clearing laws in Queensland

image.altText: A man wearing glasses and in a gray jumper sitting a school photo shoot.

props.synopsis: A school principal accused of child sexual abuse was shuffled onto a series of new jobs, correspondence shows.

title.children: Documents show Victoria's education department ignored complaints about 'psychopathic rapist' principal

image.altText: Three poker machines in a club with brightly coloured screens showing different gambling games, with three empty stools in front

props.synopsis: Not-for-profit pokies clubs in the Northern Territory are supposed to contribute part of their profits for the benefit of the wider community, but data shows some are effectively opting out of the voluntary scheme.

title.children: Clubs accused of 'whitewashing' pokies revenue through benefit scheme

image.altText: A graphic design of a plane, a NZ passport, a boarding pass and money.

props.synopsis: A former lawyer who received $1 million by mistake in a bank error transferred the money offshore, declared bankruptcy and left the country under a false name, a court has heard.

title.children: 'This is not true': Melbourne lawyer denies fleeing after $1.2m error

image.altText: Frank hugging Annie, Annie stand on her hind legs hugging Frank, both facing each other. Dogs around them, grass & fence.

props.synopsis: Frank Finger says he has been "overwhelmed" with the outpouring of support from the community since the death of his wife Cathy and dog Annie.

title.children: Muster Dogs icon mourns loss of wife and champion dog two days apart

image.altText: A child in a sports jersey punches a punching bag.

props.synopsis: First Nations man and founder of Cuz Boxing Joe Hedger spends his days helping young people at risk. As Canberra raises the age of criminal responsibility to 14, services like his will be at the forefront of change.

title.children: 'They belong at school': ACT raises the age of criminal responsibility

image.altText: Rafael Grossi wearing a dark suit jacket, blue shirt and maroon tie looking to his left in front of a blurred blue UN flag

props.synopsis: The International Atomic Energy Agency's chief raises more doubt about the efficacy of the US bombing of key Iranian nuclear facilities, which Donald Trump maintains were "oblierated".

title.children: Iran could enrich uranium within months, UN nuclear watchdog boss says

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying together.

props.synopsis: A Ukrainian fighter pilot has died in a crash while repelling a Russian night-time attack that involved hundreds of drones and missiles, the Ukrainian military said on Sunday.

title.children: Ukrainian F-16 pilot killed while repelling large Russian air attack

image.altText: Palestinian women mourning and crying out the front of a hospital.

props.synopsis: Local medics say at least 23 people were killed by Israeli air strikes and gunfire in the Palestinian enclave, as Arab states and the United States renew efforts to reach a ceasefire.

title.children: Israel begins new push in Gaza as Trump calls for hostage 'deal'

image.altText: Oscar Piastri of Australia and McLaren on the podium

props.synopsis: Oscar Piastri's lead in the Formula 1 drivers' championship has been reduced to 15 points, but it could have been much worse after a hair-raising moment with a backmarker in Austria.

title.children: Piastri survives two close calls, Williams' car catches fire in the pits

image.altText: A photo of a laptop with a hand on the keyboard showing a photo of damage to a drywall.

props.synopsis: The ABC has spoken with several workers who are urgently calling for an independent complaints mechanism that allows reports to be made anonymously and without fear of reprisal.

title.children: Workers threatened with weapons and 'jumped' inside residential care homes

image.altText: A waterfall on a rocky landscape, with green trees growing on all sides of the water.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's popular Litchfield National Park is set to expand by 20 per cent, giving Territorians and visitors more places to camp, four-wheel drive, swim and hunt.

title.children: Popular waterfalls to join Litchfield National Park in 30,000ha expansion

image.altText: An asphalt surface marked with tyre skid patterns.

props.synopsis: A 22-year-old man will face court after allegedly killing an onlooker while performing a burnout near Newcastle at the weekend.

title.children: Police charge driver over alleged burnout that killed onlooker

image.altText: A man in a wheelchair holding a cane next to someone walking and wearing jeans.

props.synopsis: A new report has recommended four policy changes to "save" the NDIS, as negotiations between federal and state governments stall over a funding deal for a new tier of services to be set up outside the scheme.

title.children: New blueprint to 'save' NDIS as disability reforms stall

image.altText: Close shot of a man looking sad and cold, wearing a blue beanie, raincoat and messenger bag on a city street

props.synopsis: The Story of Souleymane is a tense and claustrophobic tale of a Guinean food-delivery worker in Paris whose life is mired in soul-sapping cycles of bureaucracy as he seeks asylum in France.

title.children: Exploitation of food delivery workers laid bare in new film set in Paris

image.altText: Molly Picklum holds up the Rio Pro trophy.

props.synopsis: Australian surfer Molly Picklum shows why she is top of the women's World Surfing League standings, claiming her first win on tour this season in Saquarema, Brazil.

title.children: 'Scared' Picklum leads the way after Rio Pro victory
